title: Initialize a Repository
description:
Welcome to Git Gud! Let's get started by creating your first Git repository.

Create a new Git repository by using the 'git init' command.
hints: Type 'git init' to initialize a new repository.

title: Check Repository Status
description:
Now that you have a repository, let's check its status to see what files are tracked, modified, or staged.

Use the appropriate command to check the repository status.
hints: The command to check repository status is 'git status'.

title: Stage and Commit a File
description:
Let's add a file to your repository and record those changes.

First, stage file.txt using 'git add', then commit it with a message.
hints: Use 'git add file.txt' to stage the file.
Then use 'git commit -m "Your message here"' to create a commit.

title: Add and Commit in One Step
description:
Sometimes you want to stage all your changes and commit them quickly.

Add all modified files to the staging area and commit them in a single step.
hints: Many Git commands support flags to modify their behavior and perform multiple operations at once.
The 'git commit' command has a flag that can automatically stage all tracked files before committing.
Use 'git commit -a -m "Your message"' to stage all tracked files and commit them in one step.

title: View Commit History
description:
Let's look at the commit history to see what changes have been made.

Use the command to view the commit history.
hints: Use 'git log' to see the commit history.

title: Create a Branch
description:
Branches allow you to work on different features or fixes in isolation.

Create a new branch called 'feature'.
hints: Use 'git branch feature' to create a new branch.

title: Switch Branches
description:
Now that you've created a branch, let's switch to it.

Use the checkout command to switch to the 'feature' branch.
hints: Use 'git checkout feature' to switch to the branch.
In newer Git versions, you could also use 'git switch feature'.

title: Delete a Branch
description:
When you're done with a branch, you can delete it to keep your repository clean.

Create a branch called 'temp-branch', then delete it.
hints: First create the branch with 'git branch temp-branch'.
Then delete it with 'git branch -d temp-branch'.

title: Clone a Repository
description:
Cloning allows you to create a local copy of a remote repository.

Clone the sample repository using the provided URL:
https://github.com/example/repo.git
hints: Use 'git clone https://github.com/example/repo.git' to clone a repository.

title: View Changes
description:
See what changes you've made since the last commit.

Use the appropriate command to check the differences between your working directory and the last commit.
hints: Use 'git diff' to see unstaged changes since the last commit.
